title: Hardy–Littlewood inequality
summary: In mathematical analysis, the Hardy–Littlewood inequality, named after G. H. Hardy and John Edensor Littlewood, states that if f {\displaystyle f} and g {\displaystyle g} are nonnegative measurable real functions vanishing at infinity that are defined on n {\displaystyle n} -dimensional Euclidean space R n {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n}} , then
